title: If a compound is highly stable, then what can you say about its melting and boiling points? - Quora

response.answer_text: Stabilty and thermodynamic properties(m.p and b.p) are two different things.for example “florine”is highly stable in halogen but it is a gas at room temprature.also benzene is stable but its m.p and b.p are low . so,we should have to clear the concepts of these two things. If you are facing more problem then you can contact me on phone no or fb Fb:mohammad abubakar irshad Contact no:03338015155

Absolutely NOTHING. Hydrogen chloride is perfectly stable. It melts at -115°C and boils at -85°C. Water also is stable - everyone knows at which temperatures it melts and boils. Silicon dioxide is another very stable compound: it melts at about 1700°C - don’t know if someone has ever measured its boiling point.
